Sudjenje predsedniku sindikata „ Zastava oružje“ zbog navodnog napada na pukovnika VS

04 Nov 2019, 18:00

Pred Osnovnim sudom u Kragujevcu vodi se glavni pretres u postupku protiv predsednika Samostalnog sindikata fabrike „Zastava oružje“ Dragana Ilića za napad na predsednika Nadzornog odbora fabrike pukovnika Vojske Srbije Ivicu Marjanovića.Protiv Ilića je optužnicu podiglo Osnovno javno tužilaštvo za krivično delo napad na službeno lice u vršenju službene dužnosti, a Marjanović se na današnjem ročištu pridružio gonjenju. Ilić je, navodno, u vreme štrajka oružara, 18. maja 2018. godine pretio, a onda i krenuo rukom u nameri udari Marjanovića. Kako Marjanović tvrdi, u pokušaju da to izbegne povukao se nazad, udario u štok masivnih drvenih vrata i zadobio povredu kičme. Zbog tih povreda je, kako tvrdi, istog dana morao da ode na pregled u Vojnomedicinsku akademiju. Na današnjem glavnom pretresu Ilić se izjasnio da nije kriv i da ne priznaje delo koje mu se stavlja na teret. „Zbog svega onoga što se dogadjalo u prethodnom periodu i načina na koji je podignuta optužnica, mogu da kažem da je ovo jedan politički proces protiv mene kao predsednika sindikata kako bi se suzbila radnička borba, oslabio sindikat koji je do sada bio prepoznatljiv u zaštiti radničkih interesa“ rekao je Ilić Beti posle održanog ročišta kome je u svojstvu javnosti prisustvovalo desetak članova sindikalnog odbora " Namenske". Ilić je dodao je da se sve to sprovodi direktno od Vlade Republike Srbije obzirom da je Nadzorni odbor imenovan odlukom Vlade Srbije i od strane predsednice Ane Brnabić. Predsednik Nadzornog odbora fabrike „ Zastava oružje“ Ivica Marjanović je u izjavi Beti posle ročišta odbacio optužbe Ilića i naveo da nije u pitanju nikakav pritisak prema sindikatu. „Ovde je reč direktno o odnosu lidera sindikata Dragana Ilića i pokušaju fizičkog nasilja prema meni kao predsedniku Nadzornog odbora i zastrašivanje kompletnog NO„ rekao je Marjanović posle sudjenja, na koje je došao u svečanoj uniformi Vojske Srbije. On je naglasio i da je izložen pritiscima u nekim medijima i naveo list „Danas“ i pojedine lokalne novine koje, kaže, ne žele da čuju drugu stranu. „Svedoci u postupku se nazivaju lažnim, vredja se uniforma Vojske Srbije i neki članovi Nadzornog odbora što je nedopustivo“ rekao je Marjanović. Glavni pretres koji je počeo danas saslušanjem Ilića i Marjanovića biće nastavljen 10. decembra pred Osnovnim sudom u Kragujevcu.

Trial to the president of the Zastava Arms Union for allegedly attacking a colonel in the VS

04 Nov 2019, 17:00

Main trial in Kragujevac is taking place in the main trial against Dragan Ilic, the president of the Autonomous Trade Union of the Zastava Arms factory, for assaulting the chairman of the Supervisory Board of the factory of Colonel of the Serbian Armed Forces Ivica Marjanovic. in his official capacity, and at today's hearing, Marjanovic joined the prosecution. Ilic allegedly threatened, at the time of the gunmen's strike, on May 18, 2018, and then went hand in hand to strike Marjanovic. As Marjanovic claims, in an attempt to avoid it he pulled back, hit a massive wooden door and suffered a spinal injury. As a result of these injuries, he had to go to the Military Medical Academy for examination the same day. At today's trial, Ilic pleaded not guilty and did not admit to the act charged. "Because of all the things that have happened in the previous period and the way the indictment was filed, I can say that this is a political process against me as president of the union in order to suppress the labor struggle, weaken the union which has been recognizable in the protection of workers so far. of interest, "said Beti Ilic after a hearing that was attended by a dozen members of the Namenska union committee. Ilic added that all this is implemented directly by the Government of the Republic of Serbia, since the Supervisory Board was appointed by the decision of the Government of Serbia and by President Ana Brnabic. Ivica Marjanovic, president of the Supervisory Board of the Zastava Arms factory, in a statement to Betty after the hearing rejected the allegations of Ilic, stating that there was no pressure on the union. "This is directly about the union leader Dragan Ilic's attitude and the attempted physical violence against me as chairman of the Supervisory Board and intimidation of the entire NO," Marjanovic said after the trial, to which he came in a ceremonial Serbian Army uniform. He stressed that he was exposed to pressures in some media outlets, citing the Today newspaper and some local newspapers, which he said did not want to hear the other side. "The witnesses in the proceedings are called false, the uniform of the Serbian Armed Forces and some members of the Supervisory Board are being evaluated, which is inadmissible," Marjanovic said. The main trial, which began today with the hearing of Ilic and Marjanovic, will continue on December 10 before the Kragujevac Basic Court.
